Terminal Maintenance Officer Job at Sahara Group




        
    

        
        Sahara Group is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate with operations in over 38 countries across Africa, Middle East, Europe and Asia. Spanning three decades, we have broken ground and challenged stereotypes across the global business landscape. The women and men who make up our organization are our strongest levers for growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Terminal Maintenance Officer

Job Identification: 411
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers 
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Accountabilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensure daily, weekly and monthly checks on all depot equipment to ensure smooth running of operations.
	Ensure all depot equipment is working optimally.
	Maintain equipment service records.
	Ensure availability of equipment spare parts.
	Ensure compliance with company HSE policy in the execution of all maintenance activities.
	Ensure timely and precise reports on all maintenance activities to the line manager.
	Plan and prioritize depot maintenance to ensure no disruption/downtime to loading and discharging activities.
	Ensure the cost of maintenance is within the approved budget.
	Provide support during quality audits from regulatory bodies.
	Prompt response to reports on faults of equipment and tools.
	Effective negotiation to reduce the cost of equipment maintenance.
	Other assigned responsibilities.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering or relevant fields
	At least 2 years of work experience in a similar role.
	Relevant professional training and certification is highly desirable. 
	Experienced in installation, servicing and maintenance of Power generators and valves.
	Good working knowledge of process line fittings installation, and maintenance. 
	Good working knowledge of Pumps and Motors.
	Good working knowledge of project management.
	Good working experience in engine assembly in accordance with engineering drawings.
	Good working experience in HSE management.
	Good working knowledge of maintenance management.
	Diesel Generator installations and maintenance.
	AutoCAD (for mechanical Designs and Drafting).
	Experience in piping pipeline and process control.


Working Relationship:


	Terminal Manager
	Terminal Operators
	Other Departments.

Warehouse & Logistics Manager Job at Iknorbert Communications Limited




        
    

        
        Iknorbert Communications Limited was established as a company in 2012 after a critical research and observation of the need for a wider deep distribution channel for communication products within the African continent. Hence the establishment with the aim of sales and distribution of information communication technology and allied products within the Africa continent. At IKNORBERT, our products, people and business model are of standard and second to none within the industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse & Logistics Manager
Job Location: Ojodu Berger / Opic, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We have an urgent need for a Warehouse and Logistics Manager for one of our locations situated at Ojodu Berger / Opic area of Lagos State.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement warehouse policies, procedures, and operational guidelines to ensure efficient and safe warehouse operations, compliance with regulations, and management satisfaction.
	Plan and coordinate the receipt, storage, and delivery of goods, materials, and products, optimizing warehouse layout, storage systems, and workflow to maximize space utilization and productivity.
	Supervise warehouse staff, including warehouse supervisors, forklift operators, loaders, and off loaders, providing leadership, direction, and training to ensure performance and productivity.
	Monitor inventory levels, stock movements, and replenishment activities, conducting regular cycle counts, audits, and inventory checks to maintain accurate inventory records and prevent stockouts or overstocking.
	Implement inventory management techniques, such as ABC analysis, FIFO/LIFO, and batch tracking, to prioritize inventory, minimize loading/offloading costs, and optimize stock levels.
	Ensure compliance with safety regulations, security protocols, and workplace health standards, conducting regular safety inspections, training sessions, and emergency drills to maintain a safe and healthy work environment.


Logistics:


	As a Logistics Manager, you will manage logistics processes, including transportation, warehousing, inventory management, and order fulfillment, to optimize resource utilization, minimize costs, and meet the Branches' demands.
	Plan and coordinate logistics operations, including transportation, distribution, warehousing, inventory management, and order fulfillment, to meet branches' requirements and delivery schedules.
	Manage transportation activities, including transporter selection, routing, scheduling, and cost negotiation, to ensure timely and cost-effective delivery of goods to all branches.
	Monitor and track shipments, orders, and inventory levels, ensuring real-time visibility and control over logistics operations.
	Planning and monitoring inbound and outgoing deliveries.
	Organizing the warehouse, labelling goods, plotting routes, and processing deliveries.
	Responding to any issues or complaints.


Requirements


	B.Sc Degree in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or a related field; master's degree or professional certification (e.g., APICS, CSCP) is a plus.
	Proven experience in warehouse management, distribution, or logistics operations, with a track record of managing large-scale warehouses or distribution branches.
	Strong knowledge of warehouse operations, inventory management principles, logistics processes, and supply chain best practices, with experience in implementing warehouse management systems.
	Proven experience in logistics management, supply chain operations, or transportation management, with a track record of achieving results and improving efficiency.
	Strong knowledge of logistics principles, practices, and processes, including transportation modes, warehousing operations, inventory management, and distribution strategies.
	In-depth knowledge and usage of Microsoft Suite, especially EXCEL, POWERPOINT, WORD, ETC
	Proximity to OJODU-BERGER is an added advantage.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@iknorbert.com using the Job Position and Job Location as the subject of the email.
